fields.description:
h3. Summary

When we add a PDF file to a page using the view file macro the links which are present on the PDF file does not function.

h3. Environment
Confluence 5.10.x

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Attach a PDF file with links to the page (see attachment for example)
# Edit the page and insert the PDF file from *Insert dropdown >> Files and images*
# Try to preview the PDF file and click the link

h3. Expected Results
The Browser should be directed to the links

h3. Actual Results
The links are not working

h3. Notes
This is not encountered on Confluence 5.8.x or 5.9.x
fields.summary: Links in PDF preview do not work

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you press CTRL+Z or CMD+Z to undo text in Firefox, the page view in the editor jumps to a random position instead of staying where the insertion cursor is at.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page called 'Page A'.
 # Add some text into the page. Use this storage format to populate the page with dummy text:  [^CONF-43510.rtf] 
 # Add a new paragraph at the end of the page.
 # Wait a few seconds and undo the text.

h3. Expected Results
The page editor should stay where it is with the last bit of text inserted gone from the page.

h3. Actual Results
The page editor jumps up to a random location of the page, and the last inserted text is gone.

h3. Environment
||Browser||Result||
|Internet Explorer 11|Can't be replicated. (x)|
|Google Chrome 51.0.2704.103 (64-bit)|Can't be replicated. (x)|
|Firefox 48.0|Can be replicated. (/)|
|Safari Version 9.1.1 (11601.6.17)|Can't be replicated. (x)|
fields.summary: Undo text in Firefox results in the page view to jump to a random position

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you have an image whose height is larger than the height of the Confluence page editor (so that the top of the image is truncated or hidden when you scroll to the bottom of the image), typing any text on the same line as where the image is causes the insertion cursor to be hidden from view. The page editor immediately jumps up so that the top of the image can be seen, but the text that the user is typing is hidden.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page called 'Page A'.
 # Add an image as an attachment to the page. You can use this image:
  !Search results page.png|thumbnail! 
 # Add the attachment to the page. Make sure the height of the image is large enough so that you have to scroll up/down to view the full image.
 # Try to type text on the same line as the image.

h3. Expected Results
The page editor should stay where it is and allow me to see what I'm typing.

h3. Actual Results
I can't see the text that I'm typing as the insertion cursor has been hidden from view. The page editor also jumps up so that the top of the image is seen.

h3. Environment
||Browser||Result||
|Internet Explorer 11|Can't be replicated. (x)|
|Google Chrome 51.0.2704.103 (64-bit)|Can't be replicated. (x)|
|Firefox 48.0|Can't be replicated. (x)|
|Safari Version 9.1.1 (11601.6.17)|Can be replicated. (/)|

h3. Issue Replication
Video can be found here:  [^CONF-43509.mov]
fields.summary: Typing on the same line as a large image hides the text from view in Safari

fields.description:
h4.Steps to Reproduce
# Have Confluence 5.10.x installed using the [supported version|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Supported+Platforms] of Java
# Go to Confluence Admin > Support Tools > Instance Health
# Scroll down to find "Supported Platforms" > "Java Version and Vendor". Expand this

h5. Actual result
* Result is correctly shown:
{panel}
Your Java version, 1.8.0 and vendor, Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment are supported.
{panel}
* However, there is a link of "More Information" that links users to the page [JDK is outdated - upgrade Java|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/JDK+is+outdated+-+Upgrade+Java]
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h5. Expected result
* Since Java version used complies to the supported Java versions, users are not linked to the page [JDK is outdated - upgrade Java|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/JDK+is+outdated+-+Upgrade+Java]

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43505].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The *Spaces* menu in the top bar has a drop-down which shows each space of the instance. However, when we minimize the window of the browser so that the _Spaces_ item shows inside the *More* drop-down list, the *Spaces* button loses it's drop list.

The interesting part here is that if the Spaces menu is working and we minimize it, the list will still show up even though the Spaces button is under *More*. However, if we refresh the page the list is gone. The same happens if the problem is occurring and you maximize the window so that the spaces gets back to the top bar, the problem still happens until the page gets refreshed.

h3. Environment
* Happens with any browser in any OS.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open the dashboard page in a browser;
# Check that the Spaces drop-down menu works;
# Minimize the page so that the Spaces button goes under the *More* button, becoming accessible through the More drop-down list;
# Refresh the page

h3. Expected Results
* The Spaces button inside the *More* list should show the list of the spaces just like it shows before refreshing the page.
!Working1.png|thumbnail!
!Working2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
* The Spaces button doesn't have the drop list to show the spaces.
!NotWorking1.png|thumbnail!
!NotWorking2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
* There's no error entries in the logs and neither network errors in the developer tools of the browser.
* I noticed that the CSS class is different when the Spaces button is in the top bar compared to when it's under the More button. Thus when we refresh the page the Browser's cache gets overwritten with the new class that doesn't have the drop list.

h3. Workaround
# Keep the window big enough so that the Spaces menu doesn't go under the *More* button;
# Zoom out the page so that the Spaces menu doesn't go under the *More* button.
fields.summary: Spaces Dropdown Menu Doens't Show When It's Under the More Menu

fields.description:
Steps to replicate
# Install Confluence 5.8.18 or 5.10.3 with Oracle 12c
# Login to Confluence
# Create a new Space
# Create a new page
# Generate 1001 dummy files
# Drag all 1001 files and drop it to the newly created page
# Save the page
# Click on one of the files to preview after saving and you will see the following error in the logs :
{code}Caused by: java.sql.SQLSyntaxErrorException: ORA-01795: maximum number of expressions in a list is 1000

	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIoer.processError(T4CTTIoer.java:450)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIoer.processError(T4CTTIoer.java:399)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4C8Oall.processError(T4C8Oall.java:1059)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIfun.receive(T4CTTIfun.java:522)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIfun.doRPC(T4CTTIfun.java:257)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4C8Oall.doOALL(T4C8Oall.java:587)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CPreparedStatement.doOall8(T4CPreparedStatement.java:225)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CPreparedStatement.doOall8(T4CPreparedStatement.java:53)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CPreparedStatement.executeForDescribe(T4CPreparedStatement.java:774)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleStatement.executeMaybeDescribe(OracleStatement.java:925)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleStatement.doExecuteWithTimeout(OracleStatement.java:1111)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.OraclePreparedStatement.executeInternal(OraclePreparedStatement.java:4798)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.OraclePreparedStatement.executeQuery(OraclePreparedStatement.java:4845)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.OraclePreparedStatementWrapper.executeQuery(OraclePreparedStatementWrapper.java:1501)
	at com.mchange.v2.c3p0.impl.NewProxyPreparedStatement.executeQuery(NewProxyPreparedStatement.java:379)
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.BatcherImpl.getResultSet(BatcherImpl.java:89)
	at net.sf.hibernate.loader.Loader.getResultSet(Loader.java:880)
	at net.sf.hibernate.loader.Loader.doQuery(Loader.java:273)
	at net.sf.hibernate.loader.Loader.doQueryAndInitializeNonLazyCollections(Loader.java:138)
	at net.sf.hibernate.loader.Loader.doList(Loader.java:1063)
	at net.sf.hibernate.loader.Loader.list(Loader.java:1048)
	at net.sf.hibernate.hql.QueryTranslator.list(QueryTranslator.java:854)
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.find(SessionImpl.java:1570)
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.QueryImpl.list(QueryImpl.java:49)
	at com.atlassian.hibernate.HibernateObjectDao.lambda$findNamedQueryStringParams$5(HibernateObjectDao.java:432)
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTemplate.execute(HibernateTemplate.java:370)
	... 324 more{code}

*Current behavior* :  an Oracle error is thrown if more than 1000 attachments is being attached to a page.
*Expected behavior* : Oracle error should not be thrown when more than 1000 attachment is being attached.

h3. Possible Workaround 

If the issue is occurring due to attachment versions, try the following for attachments with many versions:
# Download the latest version of an attachment
# Delete the attachment from the page
# Go to Space Tools >> Content Tools >> Trash
# Click on Purge All or purge only the attachment in question
-- The entries will be removed from the database including all older versions
# Add the attachment back to the same page

h3. Mass Attachment Deletion Workaround 

It is also possible to delete older versions of the attachment via the database: 

(!) We always recommend taking a database backup before trying any database manipulation queries. 
(i) Confluence must be stopped when running these DELETE commands

Locate the page-id for a problem page. This can be found by navigating to the page information ((***) > Page Information)) for the page. It will give you a URL like:
{noformat}
http://localhost:8090/pages/viewinfo.action?pageId=2654209
{noformat}
The number at the end is the page id that will be substituted in for *<page-id>* in the queries below:
{noformat}
DELETE FROM contentproperties WHERE contentid IN (SELECT contentid FROM content WHERE contenttype = 'ATTACHMENT' AND PAGEID = <page-id> and prevver IS NOT NULL);
DELETE FROM content WHERE contenttype = 'ATTACHMENT' AND PAGEID = <page-id> and prevver IS NOT NULL;
{noformat}
fields.summary: ORA-01795 is thrown when a single page have more than 1000 attachments

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Custom Colour Schemes do not change the dropdown menu for the Application Navigation Bar.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Customize your color scheme (General Admin > Colour Scheme)
# Change the colors of links and menu items
# Save
# Ensure you have an application link between Confluence and another application
# Click the application navigation bar menu

h3. Expected Results
The application navigation menu takes on the custom colors like the other menu items:
 !colorscheme_applied_menu.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The application navigation menu does not take on any customizations:
 !colorscheme_navbar.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Add the following to CSS your [Confluence Stylesheet|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Styling+Confluence+with+CSS], replacing the color with your desired color:
{code}
div#app-switcher a {color:hotpink;}
{code}
(i) Note: the customization is not applied to the app-switcher dropdown on the admin screen, but will be on other pages.
fields.summary: Custom Colour Scheme Settings do not apply to Application Navigation Bar

fields.description:
h2. Problem summary
The functionality which generates a page tree for customized space exports is taking much longer in 5.8, 5.9, and even more so in 5.10. This page tree can be observed at Space Tools > Content Tools > Export > Any Option > Custom Export, with the specific request URL being http://<confluence_url>/spaces/exportspacetree.action?key=SPACEKEY.

With a large enough space, the request will time out after hitting a Confluence or proxy server timeout, and prevent users from customizing the space export. Smaller spaces do not run into this issue, but then again there is less need to pick-and-choose pages to export in a smaller space to begin with. Many customers use this feature to export a subset of a large space to PDF, and this performance regression blocks that functionality.

h2. Speed comparison
Since this issue is about a performance regression since 5.7, we need to compare the load times in each major Confluence version for http://<confluence_url>/spaces/exportspacetree.action?key=SPACEKEY given the same set of data. The below are the times I captured using [Profile Logging|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Troubleshooting+Slow+Performance+Using+Page+Request+Profiling], and also links to XML backups to the datasets I used should someone desire to reproduce for themselves.

Also included are screenshots taken using [JProfiler|https://www.ej-technologies.com/products/jprofiler/overview.html] showing a sampling of methods in 5.7, 5.8, and 5.10. This is sorted by average time.

Each data set is identical in terms of pages. There is a single space ("FOO") containing 2023 randomly generated pages that are deeply nested. The credentials to login for is admin/admin:
||Version||Time||XML Backup||Method Avg Times||
|5.7.5|22909 ms|[^conf575.zip]|!conf575_cpu_method_runnable.png|thumbnail!|
|5.8.13|36238ms|[^conf5813.zip]|!conf5813_cpu_method_runnable.png|thumbnail!|
|5.9.9|32865ms|[^conf599.zip]|N/A|
|5.10.3|42128ms|[^conf5103.zip]|!conf5103_cpu_method_runnable.png|thumbnail!|

Full profile logging results for all versions are available here: [^profiling.txt] 

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Download a version of Confluence you'd like to test
# Create a space and generate at least 2000 pages within (or use a backup XML file above)
# Turn on [Profile Logging|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Troubleshooting+Slow+Performance+Using+Page+Request+Profiling]
# Go to http://<confluence_url>/spaces/exportspacetree.action?key=SPACEKEY

h2. Workaround
Perform the request to generate the page tree once and wait several minutes. Even if a request times out from the client side the first time, the query is still fully executed on the server (although you won't have any feedback on when it finishes). On subsequent requests, Confluence may use the now-cached query results, thus reducing the time to generate the page tree on a second attempt and allow the request to complete in the UI.

h2. Notes
* There appears to be 2 performance regressions. One in between 5.7 and 5.8, and another between 5.9. and 5.10. Looking at the methods, it looks like the one between 5.7 and 5.8 may be due to changes in permission checking in regards to Edit and View page restrictions. This is possibly a result of CONF-17523
* Implementing a solution such as CONF-33751 may help so that the entire space's page tree is not loaded at once
fields.summary: Performance regression in generating page tree for custom space exports

fields.description:
h2. *Issue Summary*

When a user imports a filter from JIRA to a confluence page using the JIRA Macro, if the filter contains values from a custom field of type Version Picker from JIRA, confluence shows the wrong data.
h2. *Steps to Replicate*

*In JIRA*
 # Create a custom field of type version picker(multi versions).
 # Associate with a screen.
 # Create a ticket in the project which uses the screen the field was associated with and enter a value in the field.
 # Go to the search issue page in JIRA and search for the newly created issue.
{code}
<custom field created in step 1> is not empty
{code}
 # Save the filter.

*In Confluence*
 # Create a new issue
 # Select {{insert > JIRA Macro}}
 # filter ="name of filter in JIRA"
 # Select the field with the value to be  displayed in the {{Columns to Display}} field.
 # Save this.

h3. *Expected Result*

The result in confluence would show the same result as JIRA.

!jira.png|thumbnail!
h3. *Actual Result*

Confluence seems to show the fields database reference.

!confluence.png|thumbnail!
h2. *Workaround*
 * Use a Select list (multi select) custom field type instead of a version picker.
fields.summary: Confluence Shows wrong Result for values from Version type field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43494].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Users that contains specific special characters in the username will not be able to create any content in Confluence.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install a vanilla Confluence 5.10.3 or 7.4.4
# Add a new user. Name this user userhashtag#
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
# Login as this user
# Drop down from *Spaces* and click the *Create Space*
# Create a page from template via *•••* button next to the *Create* button

h3. Expected Results
The space creation dialogue pops up

h3. Actual Results
There is an error message displayed in the UI : "Your session has expired. Please reload the page to try again."
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

Or error message returned as (!) {{user.session.timed.out}}
 !create-space-timedout.png|thumbnail! 
 !create-dialog-timedout.png|thumbnail! 

Nothing is in the logs

h3. Notes
This issue has been observed with the following characters:
# '#"
# '/'
# '?'

(!) If users are being synchronized from an external directory like JIRA or LDAP that Confluence will successfully synchronize and create the user and allow the user to log in, but they will experience this bug.

h3. Workaround
Edit the username to not contain any special characters
fields.summary: Special Characters in username prevents them from creating a new space or new page with template - error message "Your session has expired. Please reload the page to try again." OR "user.session.timed.out"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43493].
{panel}
This has caused outages for our own internal instances and some customers as well. To mitigate this risk I would like to add this param to the setenv scripts for all Server and DC customers:

{{-XX:G1ReservePercent=20}}

To-space allocation failures are very very slow, due to some bugs in the JDK which have been fixed in Java 9. We need to avoid these collections where possible.

To briefly explain what this param does - G1GC splits the heap into regions and allocates those regions to Eden, Survivor and Tenured. When an object needs to be promoted from Eden to Survivor (for example), there needs to be enough room in a region which has been allocated to Survivor, or the heap needs to allocate a new region. If all regions are allocated, you get these failures, and you will then see 30s-1m long pauses (or worse).

The heap maintains a certain percentage of regions free in order to try to mitigate this scenario - 10% by default. This parameter will bump that up to 20%. On our internal instances this was enough to eliminate to-space allocation failures entirely, and stopped our outages. 

FYI, this is the bug I raised with Oracle, which they have fixed for Java 9: [https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8155256]
h3. Diagnosis

This parameter is helpful if you are experiencing long to-space allocation pauses in your garbage collection. To determine if this is the case:
 # [Enable GC Logging|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-enable-garbage-collection-gc-logging-300813751.html]
 # After a few days, or if you experience any outages, review the GC logs:
 -- Download [GC Viewer|https://github.com/chewiebug/GCViewer/wiki/Changelog]
 -- Open your GC logs in GC Viewer
 -- Click on the Event Details tab
 -- Check the pause types you are experiencing. If you have long 'to-space exhausted' pauses, this parameter can help.
 !gcviewer.png|height=180!
fields.summary: Increase G1GC reserve percent to 20% to stop long to-space allocation failure collections

fields.description:
h3. Summary

System Administrators were not notified via email when a user request to install add-ons
h3. Environment

Confluence 5.10.2
Mail Server (gmail) - tested locally
Customer's Mail server(Lotus notes)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a Mail server in Confluence
 -- send a test mail to ensure that mail notification is working
 # Login to Confluence as user
 # Navigate to *Profile picture >> Atlassian Marketplace*
 # Search for Add on that you like to install
 # Click Request Add-ons
 # Go to *Find new add-ons* page
 # Check the Add-ons notification in the upper right of the page or you can choose *Most requested* from the dropdown list.

h3. Expected Results

System Admin will get a mail notification and a Add-on notifiation from the Confluence add-on page as described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/UPM/Managing+user+requests+for+add-ons]
h3. Actual Results

Only Add-on notification was received.
fields.summary: Mail notification was not generated when requesting Add ons

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43491].
  {panel}

PowerPoint documents embedded in Confluence pages will only show the first frame of an embedded multimedia file.

Suggestion for future is to allow these multimedia files to be played through the PowerPoint Macro.

*Workaround*
* Embed the multimedia file into the Confluence page
* Display the multimedia file using the [Multimedia Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Multimedia+Macro]
fields.summary: Allow playback of multimedia files in MS Office PowerPoint files

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Office Excel macro does not respect the placement of images in cells in spreadsheets. Once they are uploaded to Confluence via the Office Excel Macro the images are misaligned.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Excel Spreadsheet
# Insert Images into the spreadsheet
# Save the file
# Create a Confluence page
# Attach the file
# Use the Office Excel Macro to display the file

h3. Expected Results
Images display in their cells as they do in excel
 !excel.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Images are not in original placement
 !office_excel_macro.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
It appears the alignment issue becomes worse with customized cell sizes

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at this time
fields.summary: Office Excel Macro does not properly align images in cells

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Contributors Macro is very memory intensive and Confluence crashes with an {{OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space}} error. Increasing the memory helps, but the solution isn't scalable.

h3. Environment
16 GB allocated to the JVM

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a space
# Add the Contributors Macro to a page
# Add 200+ contributors to the space
# Attempt to load the page with the Contributors macro

h3. Expected Results
The page loads

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file:
{noformat}
2016-08-12 15:37:09,409 WARN [Timer-0] [mchange.v2.async.ThreadPoolAsynchronousRunner] run com.mchange.v2.async.ThreadPoolAsynchronousRunner$DeadlockDetector@4f475e65 -- APPARENT DEADLOCK!!! Complete Status:
    Managed Threads: 3
    Active Threads: 3
    Active Tasks:
        com.mchange.v2.resourcepool.BasicResourcePool$AcquireTask@3ff95756 (com.mchange.v2.async.ThreadPoolAsynchronousRunner$PoolThread-#0)
{noformat}

{noformat}
2016-08-12 15:37:09,450 WARN [scheduler_Worker-1] [confluence.util.profiling.DefaultActivityMonitor] close Exceeded the threshold of 60000 ms: ActivitySnapshot{startTime=1471040790785, threadId=19, threadName='scheduler_Worker-1', userId='', type='scheduled-job', summary='flushEdgeIndexQueue'}
2016-08-12 15:37:09,477 WARN [http-bio-8090-exec-35] [render.xhtml.transformers.DefaultFragmentTransformer] transformFragment Rendering: 'page: Fight Club Home v.36 (xxxxx)' exceeded the timeout of 120 seconds by 592723 milliseconds
 -- url: /display/SPACE/SPACE+Home | userName: xxxxx | action: viewpage | page: xxxxx
{noformat}

{noformat}
2016-08-12 15:38:20,240 WARN [http-bio-8090-exec-38] [render.xhtml.transformers.DefaultFragmentTransformer] transformFragment Rendering: 'page: SPACE Home v.36 (xxxxx)' exceeded the timeout of 120 seconds by 615895 milliseconds
 -- url: /display/SPACE/SPACE+Home | userName: xxxxx | action: viewpage | page: xxxxx
{noformat}

{noformat}
2016-08-12 15:41:16,554 ERROR [http-bio-8090-exec-34] [xhtml.view.macro.ViewMacroMarshaller] marshalInternal Error rendering macro: contributors
 -- url: /display/SPACE/SPACE+Home | userName: xxxxx | action: viewpage | page: xxxxx
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
* Continue to [increase the memory allocated to the JVM|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-fix-out-of-memory-errors-by-increasing-available-memory-154071.html]
* Disable the Contributors macro
*# Go to *General Administration* > *Manage Add-ons* > select _System_ in the drop down > Expand the *Confluence Contributors Plugin* > *Disable*
fields.summary: Improve performance of Contributors Macro

fields.description:
AppID's that contain special characters are rejected by Synchrony.

2016-08-17 15:27:42,711 WARN [synchrony-interop-executor:thread-1] [plugins.synchrony.config.DefaultSynchronyConfigurationManager] logJSONResponseField [Collab editing plugin] Response message for Schäferbarthold-GmbH-389d808a-b63c-3389-93c3-26ff2b9ab16d: Invalid AppID format

*Workaround*

# We generate the AppID using the organisation name from the license.  Since this is EAP if it is possible to obtain an evaluation license under a org name that does not contain special characters then that should mitigate this issue.
# If you upgraded Confluence from a milestone version and saw this problem, please try to turn Synchrony OFF and ON in the Collaborative Editing administration page (so that a new App ID will be generated). Please note that a Synchrony restart won't help.
fields.summary: Synchrony app id does not handle special characters

h3. Summary
Anonymous users are unable to perform edit in office.

* Chrome
* Firefox

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page that contains an excel/word file
# Make sure that anonymous access is enabled from the Global Permission of the Admin Console

fields.description:
We recently upgraded our Confluence Server to 5.10.2. Our JIRA install is still at 6.4.13 and we can't upgrade to 7.x due to plugin requirements. This forced us to change from TrustedApps to OAUTH authentication for app links. This seems to have broken some integrations between the two. REST calls seem to work both ways but XML RPC calls from JIRA to Confluence seem to be broken. I've tracked it down so far to a StackOverflowException on Confluence's side. I remember seeing something about Date parsing on the OAuth filter if that helps. Here's a sample call/response I've collected: {code} java POST /rpc/xmlrpc HTTP/1.1 Authorization: OAuth oauth_token="", oauth_consumer_key="", oauth_signature_method="RSA-SHA1", oauth_timestamp="", oauth_nonce="", oauth_version="1.0", oauth_signature="" Connection: close User-Agent: Host: Content-Length: 153 Content-Type: application/xml; charset=UTF-8 confluence2.getPage19795241 HTTP/1.1 200 OK Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1 X-ASEN: SEN Set-Cookie: JSESSIONID=; Path=/; HttpOnly X-AUSERNAME: admin Content-Type: text/xml Content-Length: 272 Date: Fri, 29 Jul 2016 22:37:59 GMT Connection: close faultStringjava.lang.Exception: java.lang.StackOverflowErrorfaultCode0{code} Here's the stack traces of the exceptions I see in the logs: {code}Caused by: java.lang.StackOverflowError at java.lang.StringBuffer.append(StringBuffer.java:388) at org.apache.log4j.helpers.ISO8601DateFormat.format(ISO8601DateFormat.java:143) at java.text.DateFormat.format(DateFormat.java:345) at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor112.invoke(Unknown Source) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498) at org.apache.log4j.spi.LocationInfo.(LocationInfo.java:139) at org.apache.log4j.spi.LoggingEvent.getLocationInformation(LoggingEvent.java:253) at org.apache.log4j.helpers.PatternParser$LocationPatternConverter.convert(PatternParser.java:500) at org.apache.log4j.helpers.PatternConverter.format(PatternConverter.java:65) at org.apache.log4j.PatternLayout.format(PatternLayout.java:506) at com.atlassian.confluence.util.PatternLayoutWithStackTrace.format(PatternLayoutWithStackTrace.java:26){code} {code}2016-08-02 17:00:26,415 DEBUG [http-nio-8090-exec-9] [oauth.serviceprovider.internal.AuthenticatorImpl] printMessageToDebug Validating incoming OAuth request: url: http://rpc/xmlrpc method: POST oauth_token: oauth_consumer_key: oauth_signature_method: oauth_timestamp: oauth_nonce: oauth_version: 1.0 oauth_signature: {code} We can then see the session being invalidated: {code}2016-08-02 17:00:46,796 DEBUG [http-nio-8090-exec-10] [serviceprovider.internal.servlet.OAuthFilter] doFilter OAuth invalidated the session for an OAuth request [http://192./rpc/xmlrpc] 2016-08-02 17:00:46,796 DEBUG ServletException javax.servlet.ServletException: Filter execution threw an exception{code} Yes we saw that deprecation notice: https://developer.atlassian.com/confdev/deprecated-apis/confluence-xml-rpc-and-soap-apis. Our previous version of confluence was 5.6 (with as supposed deprecated xmlrpc endpoint) and the IssueLinks was working with with that with the TrustedApps auth mode. Confluence Remote API plugin is still present and enabled and is still trying to respond (throwing that exception) instead throwing a 404 on that URI. That's why I assumed OAuth was the issue. Was this not the case? Some more follow up questions: * Am I understanding correctly that there's no way to set the current version we have of JIRA to use REST instead of XMLRPC for this functionality? * Does this mean that the change to REST calls from XMLRPC are already on the newer JIRA versions (7.x) or are you saying Issue Links itself is deprecated? h3. fields.description:
h3. Summary
Dates are not sorted correctly (using both manual YYYY/MM/DD or //-set dates) if it fulfils the following criteria:
# The first number in the dates are the same
# There is text after the dates in each row

An example of a table that can't be sorted is as below:
||Date||
|2016/06/06 test|
|2016/09/03 test|
|2016/05/21 test|

The first number in the dates (2016) are all the same, and the word "test" is inserted after the date.

h3. Environment
Tested in:
* Confluence Server 5.10.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page in Confluence 5.10.3.
# Insert this storage format into the page: [^Table sorting for dates.rtf]
# Save the page.
# Try to sort the column in Table A.
# Try to sort the column in Table B.

h3. Expected Results
*Table A and B*: Dates are sorted correctly.

h3. Actual Results
# *Table A*: Dates are not sorted at all. Clicking on the column name to sort the column does not trigger any action.
# *Table B*: Dates are sorted correctly.
fields.summary: Table sorting doesn't work when column contains date and text

fields.description:
Sorry, didn't get this working.

I did a fresh Windows 64bit Test-Installation running on port 80, accessed by a local Firefox browser. Local firewall is disabled. Editing a page is NOT possible (Not connected).

Log shows:
{code}
2016-08-16 11:09:50,067 ERROR [http-nio-80-exec-4] [confluence.plugins.synchrony.SynchronyContextProvider] getContextMap This instance could not be registered with Synchrony.
 -- referer: http://localhost/welcome.action | url: /pages/createpage.action | traceId: d198d726b5398a19 | userName: admin | action: createpage
{code}
I see that the Tomcat8 (Confluence) process spawns another Java VM (synchrony.jar) which runs for about 3 seconds with high CPU & IO before being terminated & respawned.

Server has 8 GB RAM, 2 GB allocated to Confluence, so it shouldn't be an OOM issue concerning Synchrony as this VM allocates exactly 2 GB.

Any ideas?

Jan-Peter
fields.summary: Confluence 6.0 EAP Synchrony not using JRE bundled with Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43472].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In Confluence Cloud, it is possible for a Confluence administrator to remove the *Confluence administrator* global permission for all user groups which prevents any user from performing admin actions in Confluence and revert back this issue.

h3. Suggested Solution
As a Confluence administrator, it would be better if I was prevented from removing the *Confluence administrator* global permission for the last user group that has this permission (not counting the *confluence-administrators* and *system-administrators* groups are they are reserved for Atlassian Support in Cloud).
A warning could also be displayed in case users are about to lose this permission as the only way to get it back is via Atlassian Support.
 
h3. Workaround 
Currently, if users lose the *Confluence administrator* permissions in Confluence Cloud, they will need to create a ticket to Atlassian Support so we can grant this permission back.
fields.summary: As a Confluence administrator, I would like to be prevented from removing the last Confluence administrator group

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to install add-on from Confluence attachment url


h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Install a vanilla Confluence 5.10.X instance
2. Access the instance and uploaded a valid OBR file as an attachment
3. Copy the URL to the attachment
4. Go to !https://s3.amazonaws.com/uploads.hipchat.com/10804/2041359/oZYNLidcDNI3S8o/Dashboard%20-%20Confluence%202015-05-13%2013-43-47.png! -> Add-Ons
5. Click on Upload add-on
6. Paste the URL we copied to the "From this URL" field
7. Click upload


h3. Expected Results
The URL is pointing to a valid OBR file, so the add-on should be uploaded as stated in the guide [Installing by file upload|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/UPM/Installing+add-ons#Installingadd-ons-Installingbyfileupload]

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file:
{noformat}
2016-08-15 18:50:17,191 ERROR [UpmAsynchronousTaskManager:thread-1] [rest.resources.install.InstallFromUriTask] download Error downloading plugin from http://localhost:PORT/confluence/download/attachments/folder/fileName.obr?api=v2
 -- url: /confluence/rest/plugins/1.0/ | referer: http://localhost:PORT/confluence/plugins/servlet/upm | userName: admin
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
Also tested this using a publically accessible Confluence instance using SSL and a domain. The issue is the same with other file types such as JAR. Additionally, the issue can be replicated in other applications that use UPM such as JIRA, meaning this us a UPM issue not specific to one application. This same behavior happens in the following tested versions of UPM:

2.18.2
2.18.4 
2.18.5 
2.19.1 
2.20.0 
2.21.0 
2.21.3 

h3.Workaround
The workaround is to download the file in a browser and upload via the "From my computer" option:

1. Go to !https://s3.amazonaws.com/uploads.hipchat.com/10804/2041359/oZYNLidcDNI3S8o/Dashboard%20-%20Confluence%202015-05-13%2013-43-47.png! -> Add-Ons
2. Click on Upload add-on
3. Select the file using the "From my computer" option
4. Click upload
fields.summary: Unable to install add-on from Confluence attachment URL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43468].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The fix introduced for [CONF-40499|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-40499] implements a flag that will indicate when the client-side Page Properties Report macro cannot be rendered and will trigger a page refresh that requests server-side rendering adding {{&pagepropertiesreport.serverrender}} to the URL. This fix of reloading the page is a time-consuming wait for large pages as it will have to be loaded twice.

Details of the fix are described in: [CONF-40499 Degrade to server-side rendering if page properties report cannot be rendered client-side|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/confluence-masterdetail-plugin/pull-requests/58/conf-40499-degrade-to-server-side/diff], 

h3. Suggested Solution
A solution that doesn't require loading the page twice
fields.summary: Server-side rendering bug fix not optimized for large pages

No workaround has been discovered

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43465].
  {panel}

Team Calendars data is stored in the BANDANA tables in the Confluence DB and not included in Space XML export containing Team Calendar data.

Confluence user does not aware of this expected behaviour which only discover that the contents of the Team Calendars were not migrated during the space migration.

There is an existing feature request for this:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/TEAMCAL-1628

Therefore, it would be better if we can update the docimentation to add a warning (just before the data export or simply within the Confluence documentation) stating that the Team Calendars data will not be included in the XML Space export.
fields.summary: Include a small note in Confluence Space XML export documentation.

h3. Summary
The 'Confluence Page Gadget' is truncated in height when you refresh the page after viewing it for the first time.

 # Create a new page called 'Page A'.
 # Insert this text into the page: [^australia.content.txt]
 # Save 'Page A'.
 # Create another new page called 'Page B'.
 # Insert "Confluence Page Gadget" into this page and embed Page A in the gadget.
 # Save 'Page B'.

The Confluence Page Gadget should still display the content of Page A in the gadget as it looked before.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43427].
  {panel}

We are migrating from hosted Confluence (atlassian.net) to self-hosted.

Our dump is some 24GB.

I can't tell how long the dump takes. Since I am going to have to take Confluence offline in a medical environment for some time for the migration, I'd like to tell customers how long it's going to take -- but since your UI doesn't say how long it took to do the backup dump to the ZIP'd XML, I'm driving blind.

I see other tickets asking for it to be speedier -- It is so slow that I just launch it at night and check in the morning.

It seems to take at least two hours, but I need a firmer time so that I can create as short a window as possible for the migration.

It is bad enough that I have to unzip / run Perl / re-zip to accommodate a bug (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-38089) -- so getting that timing information would really help.
fields.summary: Show time it took to create a backup in hosted Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
New German translation in 5.10 is not really correct and can create confusion for users 

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.10

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set Confluence in English
# Check the main Dashboard there is a tab called "Saved for later"
# Check any page you have access to, you will find a star menu called "Save for later" 
# Change your personal settings to Deutsch
# Check the main Dashboard, the "Saved for later" tab is "Gespeichert für später"
# Check any page you have access to, the "Save for later" button is "Favorit"

h3. Expected Results

Using Deutsch, we expect to see "Save for later" to be  "Speichern für später"

h3. Actual Results

"Save for later" button is "Favorit" which is not a correct translation.
fields.summary: Wrong German translation
Limit the number of topics used by a user
Allow creating a default template

Customer wants to have same page in different spaces

Duplicate pages between projects and sync them 

h3. Workaround 
(Optional)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43420].
  {panel}

Hello,

we have a problem with the automatic index. if the DB Connection is lost for few seconds or milli seconds, then will the automatic index not working.

The index will working after restart the application.

If you the problem is known? 
Can you help me?

Best regards
Nadine Walter
fields.summary: Automatic index not working
Grant Access option

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If an Info, Tip, Note or Warning Macro is placed within a User Macro that has the Macro Body Processing set to *Rendered* the PDF export will throw a NullPionterException. Setting it to *Unrendered* causes the macro to display incorrectly.

h2. Rendered User Macro
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create User Macro
{panel}
Macro Name: passthrough
Processing: Rendered
Template:
{code}
Template:
  ## @noparams
  $body
{code}
{panel}
# Create Confluence Page
# Insert the {{passthrough}} macro
# Insert the Info, Tip, Note, or Warning macro within the passthrough macro
# Save
# Export to PDF

h3. Expected Results
You are prompted to save the exported PDF

h3. Actual Results
You receive an {{Oops- an error as occurred page}}.
 !oops.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43415].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Depending on how many Blog posts the user have to maintain and create, the list that groups blog posts by month may extend too much causing the tree to have a huge expandable list.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make possible for the user to select the wanted grouping:
* Day;
* Week;
* Month.

Or have Confluence to automatically group pages in different sections as needed.

Preferred structure:
* 2016
** August
*** 01
**** Blog #1
**** Blog #2
**** Blog #3
*** 02
*** 03
*** 04
*** 05
**** Blog #4
**** Blog #5
fields.summary: Provide the option to organise Blog Posts and group them by day or week, instead of only month.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The "Labels Gadget" macro is not working in Confluence. The *Project* dropdown menu is not working so you are not able to fill all the fields and save the macro. The "Please complete the configuration in the preview area first" message is displayed right next to a grayed Insert button.


h3. Environment

* Confluence 5.9 or 5.10

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Application Link between Confluence and JIRA
# Add the "Labels Gadget" as an external gadget.
# Insert the gadget on a page.

h3. Expected Results

You will be able to save the gadget and get the content from JIRA

h3. Actual Results
You are not able to choose the project because the drop down menu is not working. Since you can't choose the project you can't save/insert the gadget.
 
h3. Notes
Tested in local server, in other words, Confluence and JIRA are using the localhost address and also a context path

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Labels Gadget is not working properly in Confluence

fields.description:
h4. Summary
Adding a footer or header to a space/site messes up the preview in editor mode.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Go to a space/site Look and Feel
# Add a text to either Header and/or Footer options. Example: Header test / Footer test
# Save and go to a page in a space
# Go to editor mode and click on Preview

h4. Expected Results
Page is previewed normally

h4. Actual Results
User interface is messed up. See screenshot

h4. Workaround
Remove the Header *AND* Footer
fields.summary: Header and Footer text affects Preview mode
Showing Issue Filter on Public Confluence Page
Add Notification Schemes to Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43408].
  {panel}

h5. Problem statement

In Confluence 5.10 onwards, we introduced batched notifications. However, the documentation is not clear on what actions are included in the batched notifications and what actions will result in an e-mail to be sent out immediately.

More info on the feature here: [Confluence 5.10 Release Notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+5.10+Release+Notes#Confluence5.10ReleaseNotes-Moretimeforeveryone].
h5. Suggested solution

Please update the documentation to mention the kinds of actions are part of the batched notifications and which are not.

For example, adding an attachment to the page (not the body of the page) or adding an inline comment to an attachment will immediately send out an e-mail to users watching the page/space. Editing the page content, however, will wait until the next batch window to send out the batched notifications e-mail to users.
fields.summary: Document the actions that will be included in the batched notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43407].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
If you have added Table of Contents macro that gets the information from Children Display macro, the links does not take you to the section of the page. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a PAGE 
# Create Page 1 under PAGE
# Create 5 subpages under Page 1
# Create Page 2 under PAGE
# Create 5 subpages under Page 2
# Add a Table of Contents to PAGE
# Add Children Display macro to PAGE (parent page: Page 1)
# Add another Children Display macro to PAGE (parent page: Page 2)
# Click a link of subpages from the Table of Contents

h3. Expected Results
* Clicking the link should bring you to the section of the page.

h3. Actual Results
* Clicking the link doesn't bring you to the section of the page. URL link does not contain any anchor to the section of the page.
  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
The reason for the absence of anchors in the TOC could be the lack of the "id" field in the h2 HTML that is generated for Children Display pages, as shown in the screenshots below:
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!  !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 

Contrary to what was explained in issue [CONF-42832|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-42832], a Table of contents Zone does not work around the problem.
fields.summary: Table of Contents does not properly use anchors from page links of Children Display
Wrong Hotkey for page editing

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users without rights to restrict pages within a space will not be able to move restricted pages within the same space

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a regular Confluence user (UserA)
# Create a new Confluence space using an admin account (AdminUser)
# With the AdminUser account, create a page that has *editing restriction* applied to it (PageA). You can even add the editing restriction and set it to UserA
# Logout and login using the UserA account
# Move PageA to another location within the same space 

h3. Expected Results
UserA should be able to move PageA to the other location without any problems, since the user is able to create a page within that same space under that new parent page

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the UI
{noformat}
You can not restrict pages in the destination space. Remove restrictions before moving page.
{noformat}
We should at least have a better message to say why this move is not possible.
fields.summary: Unable to Move Restricted Pages Within Same Space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43403].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Inline comments in attachment can't be deleted.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.10.0 through 5.10.3
* Confluence 1000.340.0
* Any browser 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and add an attachment (an image)
# Add an inline comment in the attachment and save it
# Try to delete it the comment

h3. Expected Results

A popup should appear and ask you to confirm that you would like to delete it

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens, the inline comment is always there
 
h3. Notes

Issue is not reproducible on 5.9.4
Confluence 1000.340.0
fields.summary: Cannot delete Inline comments in Attachments

fields.summary: The "attachmentManager.copyAttachments() " API does not copy the Creator of the page.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43401].
  {panel}

We're no longer permission-checking links on pages to other Confluence pages. We previously did this to determine if the reader had permission to see the linked page, and would link to the page ID rather than its name in cases where the reader didn't have permission to see the linked page. Given that a determined user could use the REST API to determine the name of the linked page anyway, and that the permission check comes at a performance cost, we've decided the cost of this check is too great when balanced with any perceived benefit.

This change currently only affects Confluence Cloud.

If you have comments or concerns about this, please let us know by commenting.

Thanks,

The Confluence Team
fields.summary: Change to link permission check when rendering pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43399].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Site administrators cannot disable the *All Updates* or *Popular* tabs that appear on the dashboard.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide the ability to disable this functionality in the *General Configuration* section.
h3. Workaround

* In Confluence Server, administrators could create custom CSS to hide it or use a theme. (See [How do I hide "All Updates" or "Popular" function from the Dashboard.|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=879956248]).
* To skip the dashboard altogether, you can set a space home page as the landing page for the entire site (See [Configuring the Site Home Page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-the-site-home-page-138140.html]).
fields.summary: Allow the ability to deactivate the All Updates tab

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Confluence allows us to add as many pinned comments to attachments like PDFs as we want.

However, due to a limitation in REST API, it can only load 100 of these, so adding more than 100 will cause these to not be loaded the next time the attachment is opened, even though they are present in the database.

h3. Suggested Solution
Two changes:
# Prevent users from adding more than 100 pinned comments to a single version of an attachment.
# Add this limitation to the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Share+and+Comment+on+Files]
fields.summary: Prevent users from adding more than 100 pinned comments and document it

h5. Summary:
In Confluence 5.8, when using the German Language pack, the date picker:
* Has Monday as the first day of the week
* Days are displayed in German 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

However, In Confluence 5.9 and above, when using the German Language pack, the date picker:
* Has Sunday as the first day of the week
* Days are displayed in English
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h5. Notes:
Checked in {{confluence-language-pack-de_DE-5.10.0.rc1-v2r12978-2016-06-06.jar/i18n/aui_de_DE.properties}} noticed the line
{{ajs.datepicker.localisations.first-day}} was set to {{1}}, 
{code}
ajs.datepicker.localisations.first-day=1
{code}
which supposed to set the day picker to start on Monday. However, the date picker still shows Sunday as the first day of the week

Most of European countries start the week with Monday, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Week.
h5. Workaround:
No workaround yet

fields.description:
h6. Summary 
As of Confluence 5.8, the Active Objects library was changed to use the {{NVARCHAR2}} datatype for new columns.
However, in a fresh installation of Confluence 5.9.x and 5.10.x the datatypes for AO tables' columns are still of {{VARCHAR2}} datatype.

h6. Environment 
Database: Oracle 12c
Confluence Version: Confluence 5.9.x and Confluence 5.10.x

h6. Steps to Reproduce
# Install a fresh installation of Confluence 5.9.x or Confluence 5.10.x (connected to Oracle DB 12c).
(i) Please ensure that the DB have been set up as per [Database Setup for Oracle|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Database+Setup+for+Oracle] and the correct dialect is used in {{<Confluence-Home>/confluence.cfg.xml}} file - {{<property name="hibernate.dialect">net.sf.hibernate.dialect.OracleIntlDialect</property>}}.
# Execute the query below against your Confluence DB to identify the columns with {{VARCHAR2}} datatype:
{code}
SELECT * FROM all_tab_columns WHERE owner='<Oracle-DB-Username>' AND data_type IN ('VARCHAR2');
{code}

h6. Expected Results 
All of the columns of the AO tables are supposed to be in {{NVARCHAR2}} datatype.

h6. Observed Results 
All of the columns of the AO tables are of {{VARCHAR2}} datatype.

h6.Workaround
Please contact your DB admin to ALTER the affected columns' datatypes to {{NVARCHAR2}} datatype.
fields.summary: AO Tables are Created Using the Incorrect VARCHAR Datatype in Oracle DB

fields.description:
h1. Summary

The file conversion service in Confluence could cause OutOfMemoryError due to a bug incurring a sustained CPU spike in -CONF-38233- which was subsequently fixed in Confluence 5.10.4

The file conversion service leverages the API provided by Aspose.Pdf for Java. The Aspose library might consume many memory for PDFs having either lots of objects or many contents, especially for large PDF files, say >100Mb. If the memory required is not able to be fulfilled, the OutOfMemory will occur, as a result of that, the system will be very slow to response to user's requests, and the system could be restarted to recover from this situation.
h1. How to reproduce

The issue can be reproduced with the following steps,
 # Startup a Confluence instance with the memory setting: -Xms256m -Xmx1g. 
 # Create some test pages, then attach some PDF attachments with size more than 100Mb. Note you need to adjust the "Attachment Maximum Size" via the General Configuration.
 # Click the thumbnails to view the attached PDFs
 # Continue the #2 and #3 until the OOM comes up

h1. Workaround

At this stage, the primary workaround for this issue is to *upgrade to Confluence 5.10.4* as the bug causing the CPU to spike and subsequently OOME was fixed as part of --CONF-38233--

Other, workarounds if you are already running on Confluence 5.10.4 are as the following:
 # Increase more memory to Confluence instance if possible, as the issue is caused by the short of heap memory
 # Reduce the memory spike consumed by restricting the maximum size of attachment allowed
fields.summary: File Conversion Service causes OutOfMemoryError

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Upgrading Confluence recreates the mail-x.x.x.jar file that is *moved* when creating a JNDI Connection.

As explained on [Setting Up a Mail Session for the Confluence Distribution|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Setting+Up+a+Mail+Session+for+the+Confluence+Distribution], you need to ensure that you move (don't copy) mail-x.x.x.jar from <confluence-install>\confluence\WEB-INF\lib to <confluence-install>\lib (x.x.x. represents the version numbers on the jar files in your installation).

When you upgrade Confluence, the mail-x.x.x.jar file is recreated/kept in the installation folder. This causes issues when since email will not be sent when both files are in place. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up a JNDI SMTP connection
# Upgrade Confluence manually
# Notice the upgrade tasks do not remove the mail-x.x.x.jar

h3. Expected Results
The upgrade should check to see if there is a JNDI connection originally and remove the mail-x.x.x.jar file

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file:

{noformat}
An error has occurred with sending the test email:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Mail server at location [java:comp/env/mail/GmailSMTPServer] is not of required type javax.mail.Session.
{noformat}
 

h3.Workaround
The workaround is detailed in the guide [Mail server at location is not of required type javax.mail.Session|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Mail+server+at+location+is+not+of+required+type+javax.mail.Session].

# Shutdown Confluence
# Delete the mail-x.x.x.jar from <confluence-install>\confluence\WEB-INF\lib (x.x.x. represents the version numbers on the jar files in your installation)
# Restart Confluence and attempt to [reconfigure your mail server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Setting+Up+a+Mail+Session+for+the+Confluence+Distribution] again.
fields.summary: Upgrading Confluence recreates the mail-x.x.x.jar file that is *moved* when creating a JNDI Connection.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43356].
  {panel}

At the moment there is no way to add team members to a Team Space automagically. Ideally, there would be a wizard to:
* Add the group to the Team Space permissions
* Add the members as watchers on the Team Space
* Add the members to the home page of the space under The Team (where the members added during the creation of the Team space are listed)

At present, the members have to be added separately (not as a group) and the table on the space home page has to be manually updated to include each team member's profile pic and email. In addition, the members must be added as watchers on the space. When adding an entire team that is already part of a group, this process is unwieldy.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to add a group as members of a Team Space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43354].
  {panel}

We really like the confluence roadmap planner.  Although I realize that it does not have an official API, we still found it reasonably straightforward to extract data from JIRA and our other tracking systems and automatically create custom roadmaps that help us understand how our work rolls up across 30 scrum teams.  (Note that the JIRA product roadmap tool will not work for us because we also need to display custom operational data, for which we use confluence's chart functionality to get it all into one place.)

In order to understand how the work rolls up, we define two levels of epic - larger ones that span across teams and smaller ones that belong to one team.  We really would like to be able to show the larger and smaller epics together in the same lane but in different colors so that someone viewing the page is clear that these are different things.  Different colors would also help us convey other levels of information - for example, the product or target release for an epic, or which team is actually working on it.

Note that this is *not* a request to support individual bar colors in the UI.  I realize that would likely end up being more work and introducing potential usability problems.  This request is just to support optionally including a color as part of the JSON data for the bar and displaying the bar in that color if it is present.

The lane is already being used to group related items together, so we would prefer not to have to separate these issues into different lanes.
fields.summary: Allow Roadmap Planner JSON data to support colors per-bar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-43351].
  {panel}

Current editing is painfully page-load heavy when I am creating a complex or heavily-integrated wiki space. In order to edit a different page I have three separate page loads: save current page, navigate to target page, switch to page edit.

Please create a space-wide edit mode that:
 * Opens pages in edit-mode by default
 * Keeps space navigation sidebar visible
 * Uses AJAX for page saves

This way I will be able to switch between page edits in one page load rather than 3.
fields.summary: Space-Wide Edit Mode

fields.description:
h4. Summary

Users with short names can not be @mentioned in Confluence if many other users share the *root* of the user name.
h4. Symptoms

A problem exists when username and full name are both short and similar to other names within Confluence. If a user is named with a short name such as:
 # Sue
 # Lin
 # Bob
 # Tom
 or others, then the user may not return when there are many similarly named individuals in the instance when attempting to @mention the user. Instead, you will find lots of other users, but *not* the user you are seeking to @mention.

 
h4. Steps to Reproduce

Bulk upload a large list of users with the same *root* of the user name. In my case, I used the name *Lin Lin* with a username of *lin* (an actual case of an individual having the issue). I created users named lin, lina through linz using the [User Management Util - Bulk User Upload|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.artemistech.confluence.plugins.bulkuserupload/server/overview] plugin which allowed me to quickly upload some 250 users, many with similar names to *lin* to test my theory that the search failed on discrete searches when a user has a very short name that is a root of a lot of other names:
 # Lino
 # Linda
 # Lindon
 # Linmeyer
 # Linq
 # Link
 # Lincoln
etc.
h4. Expected results

After uploading, I ran Content Indexing in the instances and attempted to @mention Lin Lin. With a small number of users in the system each with unique names and not sharing the same root of their name, this does not fail to isolate the user in question. This is to be expected, that the user *Lin Lin* would be found without issue.
h4. Actual results

However, when there are a large number of users sharing the same root to their name, the user can not be found for placing into a page, a calendar, a task assignment, etc. through the @mention method.
h4. Screen Capture of the issue

  !lins.png|thumbnail!

As you can see, there is no way to select *Lin Lin* for the purposes of an @mention in this case. This points to a defect in the discrete nature of the text search in the application. Even when using the full user name, this search fails for @mention of the user in question, and no amount of reindexing will resolve the issue:

!lin2.png|thumbnail!

h4. Workaround:
You can use an alternative method with a more robust searching option. It will link to the user's profile which will in turn mention the user as if using the @mention. Details from [Notes on Using Mentions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf54/confluence-user-s-guide/sharing-content/using-mentions#UsingMentions-Notes]:
{quote}
Linking to a user profile. You can use a square bracket '[' and a person's name to trigger Confluence autocomplete and link to a person's user profile or personal space. Confluence will send the person a notification just as if you had used @mention (unless the administrator has disabled the user mention feature).
{quote}

In the editor you can:
# Press "["
# Then start typing the name (not username) of your user  !type_name.png|thumbnail! 
# If they don't come up you can select to do a further search  !search_for_name.png|thumbnail! 
# And you'll get a window to do a full search for user profiles  !search_for_profile.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: @Mention Search has issue with discrete search
